result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Alexander Willox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob Alexander Willox is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob Alexander Willox was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1 without prejudice.
Defendant to report to Probation November 12, 2014.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF427.
Psychological Exam within 30 days and follow through with recommendations.

-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Meet with Amber Perry.
-Follow and complete all recommendations of Agent.
-Use prescription medications only in prescribed amounts.
-Shall not possess or consume alcohol at any time.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Shall not possess or consume any illegal drugs at any time and shall not possess or consume any other illegal substances or drug paraphernalia at any time.
-Defendant subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees as determined by DOC.
-Successfully complete Drug Court and extend supervision in order to complete drug court.

AODA within 30 days.
Comply with all recommendations and complete treatment.

timeConds.notes:

Condition time.
52 days STAYED.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 12CF139, 13CF126 and 14CF427:
Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Liddle.ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Jacob Alexander Willox appeared from jail. Case called at 8:20 a.m. Court reviews file. Probation revoked. Revocation and warrant issued by probation agent Ben Anderson and gives recommendations. PSI was ordered and is on file along with a compass evaluation. Court reviews charges and penalties on all 3 files. ADA Nieskes has complied with victim rights. Gives recommendations and mirrors probation agent recommendations requesting court to approve. Atty Chapman gives sentencing arguments. Defendant gives statement. Defendant has obtained GED. Court will remand defendant into custody and will be transported to Dodge Correctional. Court adjourned at 8:55 a.m. Court orders:
- 12CF139 Ct. 1 Possession of Meth
   Total sentence 3 years 6 months   IC: 1 year 6 months. ES: 2 year 0 months
   concurrent to Ct 1 13CF126. Sentence Credit 278 days
   - $255 Costs and  $2,889.44 Restitution. Defendant to make payments to probation during E.S.
- 13CF126 Ct. 1 Uttering a Forgery
  Total sentence 3 years 10 months. IC: 1 year 10 months. ES: 2 years 0 Month
 concurent to Ct 2 in 14CF427. Sentence credit 278 days
   - $531.94 Court Costs. Defendant to make payments to probation during E.S.

- 14CF427 Ct. 2 Carry a Concealed Weapon  9 months county jail
   Sentence Credit 32 days 
  - $243.00 Fine. Enter a civil judgment

-   Eligible for CIP and Substance abuse program

Conditions for Extended Supervision on 12CF139 and 13CF126:
-   Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

-   Maintain Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in   your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   AODA treatment

-   Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge

-  Pay costs and restitution

-   Submit to regular and random testing as requested

-   Maintain full time employment or education 

-   Complete MRT Treatment or an equivilant program

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Fox, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton, DF:  Jacob Alexander Willox appeared from jail. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count 2 and plea questionairre. Def pleads guilty to count 2, carry concealed weapon - repeater STRICKEN. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and enters plea.  Atty's stipulate to the facts; complaint, as factual basis. Court accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 2. Count 1 is dismissed without prejudice. Sentencing recommendations. hml Court orders: 
-  S/W 1 year probation. Sign up Wednesday, November 12, 2014
- 120 days condition time.  52 days jail stayed no later than Nov. 7, 2014 at 1:15 p.m.  32 days credit.
- AODA  within 30 days. Comply with recommendations and shall complete treatment
- Psychological exam within 30 days and follow through with recommendations
- Don't operate a motor vehicle without valid DL
- Meet with Amber Perry 
- Pay Court costs of $243
- Follow and complete all recommendations of agent
- Use prescription medications only in prescribed amounts 
- Shall not possess or consume alcohol at any time
- Shall not be present in taverns or establishments where the primary business is sale of alchol
- Shall not possess a firearm
- Shall not possess or consume any illegal drugs at any time and shall not possess or consume any other illegal substances or drug paraphernalia at any time
- Shall be subject to random UA's and PBT's 
-Shall follow all rules and regulations by agent
-Shall pay supervision fees as determined by the DOC
-Successfully complete drug court and extend supervision in order to complete drug court
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
